page.title: 10FARM-WORKERS,ST.ALLEN.
page.content: Mechanisation,small profit-margins,& hard-working owner-occupier farmers mean fewer labourers.Of the 5 full- time workers at 650 acre Killivose(3 tractor-drivers,2 stockmen), 2 live in Shortlanesend, 3 in scattered farm- cottages;a tractor-driver lives in the small 3-bedroom tied Killivose Cottage with his wife & 4 children,hoping for a council-house.His basic take-home pay is Â£79 for a 40-hour week.He works overtime in summer(8a.m._10p.m.daily). Nancarrow(125acres)employs 1 full-time worker(formerly with Youth Training Scheme)plus a Y.T.S.girl from Zelah who works 3 days weekly at the farm,2 days at Camborne Tech.earning Â£27.95 weekly of which the farmer pays Â£10. Farmworker's wives feel isolated in worker's cottages;Lanner Barton(230 acres)cottage is holiday-let & the 1 worker lives in Trispen.Car essential.
